mh

Class EscapeSequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • mh.EscapeSequence

  • public class EscapeSequence
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    ea55 This class collects elements of an escape sequence and affers mthods for parsing the sequence.

    • Method Detail

      • append

        public void append(char c)
        Append a character to the current sequence.
        Parameters:
        c - the character to append.

      • append

        public void append(java.lang.String s)
        Append a string to the current sequence.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to append.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Prepare for a new escape sequence. Resets the parse pointer and truncates the escape character string.

      • setIndex

        public void setIndex(int i)
        Set the current parsing pointer to the given index. Prepares for parsing at the given index.
        Parameters:
        i - - the index into the escape sequence [0...length(EscapeSequence) - 1].

      • incrementIndex

        public void incrementIndex(int i)
        Increment the parse pointer by the given number of characters. Nothing happens if the result would point behind the end of the EscapeSequence.
        Parameters:
        i - the number of characters to skip.

      • decrementIndex

        public void decrementIndex(int i)
        Decrement the parse pointer by the given number of characters. Nothing happens if the result would point before the start of the EscapeSequence.
        Parameters:
        i - the number of characters to go back.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return a string with this escape sequence.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • hasMore

        public boolean hasMore()
        Test whether parsing has reached the end of the sequence.
        Returns:
        true if there are more characters in this sequence.

      • startsWith

        public boolean startsWith(java.lang.String s)
        Tests whether the escape sequence starts with the given string.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to look for.
        Returns:
        true if the escape sequence starts with the given string.

      • endsWith

        public boolean endsWith(java.lang.String s)
        Tests whether the escape sequence ends with the given string.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to look for.
        Returns:
        true if the escape sequence ends with the given string.

      • getLast

        int getLast()
        Returns:
        The last character in this Escape sequence.

      • removeLast

        void removeLast()
        Remove the last character from this sequence.

      • parseASCIIInteger

        public int parseASCIIInteger()
        Parses a decimal number with an optional leading '+' or '-' sign. Advances the parse pointer only if a valid number has been parsed. If the number ends with a space, a comma, or a semicolon, this separator is skipped too so that the pointer points to the next number (if any).
        Returns:
        decimal number, if no valid number was found, Integer.MIN_VALUE is returned.

      • parseASCIIInteger

        public int parseASCIIInteger(int def)
        Parses a decimal number with an optional leading '+' or '-' sign. If no valid number is found the given default value is returned.
        Parameters:
        def - default value to return.
        Returns:
        decimal number, if no valid number was found, the value of 'def' is returned.
        See Also:
        parseASCIIInteger()

      • parseBinaryTriple

        public int parseBinaryTriple()
        Advances the parse pointer only if THREE valid bytes have been parsed.
        Returns:
        an unsigned decimal number built from two 5-bit parts, Integer.MIN_VALUE if no valid number was found.

      • parseBinaryWord

        public int parseBinaryWord()
        Advances the parse pointer only if TWO valid bytes have been parsed.
        Returns:
        an unsigned decimal number built from two 5-bit parts, Integer.MIN_VALUE if no valid number was found.

      • parseBinaryByte

        public int parseBinaryByte()
        Advances the parse pointer only if ONE valid byte has been parsed.
        Returns:
        an unsigned decimal number from a 5-bit byte, Integer.MIN_VALUE if no valid number was found.

      • parseCharacter

        public char parseCharacter()
        Return the next character in the sequence. Advances the parse pointer only if a character has been parsed.
        Returns:
        the next character or 0 if the end of the sequence has been reached.

      • peekCharacter

        public char peekCharacter()
        Return the next character in the sequence. Does not advance the parse pointer.
        Returns:
        - the next available character or 0 if the end of the sequence has been reached.
